ngiemboon: Yěsô la kúu Yelíkò, ńne ńzyɛ́ʼɛ tÿǒsoŋ,
en: He entered Jericho and was passing through.

ngiemboon: atsɔ̌ nyìŋ kẅɛ, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ lê Sakîo, á gwɔ́ tándá pakẅéncùb pà Loma, ńgwɔ́ ngàŋa mmó tɛʼ.
en: There was a man named Zacchaeus who was a chief tax collector, and he was rich.

ngiemboon: Á kẅɛ púʼu, ńne faʼa légyá yé nyìŋ gẅie Yěsô aa yé, tá à te ne ńgyá shÿó wɔ́, mélàʼmie à laa tetuʼu nyìŋ, aláʼ piŋ ńgwɔ́ nzèm Yěsô tɛʼ.
en: He was trying to see who Jesus was, but he was not able because of the crowd, since he was a short man.

ngiemboon: Á kÿote ńgʉa mvfò, á na shÿó gẅie Yěsô lɔ̌ɔn ńge cʉa mǒ, ńkwɔ́ʼ ńzébe na tsɔ́ tÿǒ, gie me tóŋ ngie tÿǒ sikomɔɔ, ḿbyɛ́b páʼ à ge gwaa cʉa, à gyá yé.
en: So running ahead, he climbed up a sycamore tree to see Jesus, since he was about to pass that way.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gʉa tà ńkúu jʉʼó, ḿbʉʼʉ twó yé ńdíe yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Lwo sẅɛ́ʼ me Sakîo, á poŋ ngie, n dáʼ pɔ́ ndá gù lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn.»
en: When Jesus came to the place, he looked up and said to him, “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down because today it is necessary for me to stay at your house.”

ngiemboon: Sakîo gwóon sẅɛ́ʼ, ńtyé ssé, ńdɔgɔ lekág ńkúe Yěsô.
en: So he quickly came down and welcomed him joyfully.

ngiemboon: Aláʼ la gyá páʼ pɔ́ yé gee, ńzẅɛ́te ńgɔɔn ngie: «À gẅie à gee né ndá nyìŋ tepòŋ ńdáʼa lɛ̂.»
en: All who saw it began to complain,   “He’s gone to stay with a sinful man.”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ye gÿo ńgwɔ́ ndá, Sakîo tyé mvfò yé ńgɔɔn ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, n ge gabte shúm sɔ́ɔn nzsè pʉ́a, é náa tàʼ nzsè mbwó pate mmó, ńgwɔ́ gie n dǎ lɔgɔ gáte ńkẅé mmó nyìŋ, mbà n ge tsɔ́ʼ náa mbwó ngàŋ ngʉ̀a lekùɔ.»
en: But Zacchaeus stood there and said to the Lord, “Look, I’ll give half of my possessions to the poor,   Lord. And if I have extorted  # 19:8 Lk 3:14 anything from anyone, I’ll pay back four times as much.”  # 19:8 Ex 22:1; Lv 6:5; Nm 5:7; 2Sm 12:6

ngiemboon: Yěsô júʼ, ńgɔɔn ngie: «E Ssé gÿǒ ayɔɔn tsìŋendá pú ńtsẅɛ́ lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, mélàʼmie Sakîo giŋé ńgwɔ́ yé tsɔ̌ míŋ Ábalaham!
en: “Today salvation    has come to this house,” Jesus told him, “because he too is a son of Abraham.   # 19:9 Lk 3:8; 13:16; Gl 3:7,29

ngiemboon: Míŋ Nyìŋ la zɔɔn ńtó pɔ́ léfaʼ pʉ̀a pie é la kúu pyé, ńgÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́.»
en: For the Son of Man has come to seek and to save the lost.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgɔɔn nò, aláʼ ne ńzẅíʼte tà ńgwóon ńne ńkwaŋa ngie lefùɔ Ssé é ge gwóon tó pɔ́ fʉʼó, ńzɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, mbà à gʉ̌a tà ńcʉ́ʼ ńgee pɔ́ ńkúu Yelúzálèm. Yěsô lɔg sagánò ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:
en: As   they were listening to this, he went on to tell a parable because he was near Jerusalem,  # 19:11 Lk 9:51 and they thought the kingdom of God was going to appear right away.  # 19:11 Lk 17:20; Ac 1:6

ngiemboon: «Atsɔ̌ múɔ ntɔ́ʼ lǎʼ ńdu ssé ńgʉa tàa túm páʼ mé ge lɔgɔ yé gÿo fùɔ ntÿɔ́ʼ tá à piŋ nzèm, ésáʼa yé pàga láʼ.
en: Therefore he said, “A nobleman traveled to a far country to receive for himself authority to be king    and then to return.

ngiemboon: Ńgwaa gʉa, ńtóŋ megàŋafàʼ pé legém, ńnáa tʉ̀nzẅìŋ pàga nkáb á mbwó wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: “Pi cʉ́ʼ ńne ńtáŋa nkáb yɛ̂ tà n dáʼ ḿbiŋ!”
en: He called ten of his servants, gave them ten minas,    and told them, ‘Engage in business until I come back.’

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńké ńgʉa. Táʼ, paláʼ apɛ̌, lɔg páʼ pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ḿbʉa yé pʉa, ńtúm pʉ̀a jʉʼ gie à gee lé wó, ngie pɔ́ gʉa ńgɔɔn ngie: “Peg te ne ńkwoŋo ngie nyìŋ wɛ̂ sáʼa wég wɔ́.”
en: “But his subjects hated him and sent a delegation after him, saying, ‘We don’t want this man to rule over us.’

ngiemboon: Tá á gʉa tà ńkúu wó, mé ke ńdɔgɔ yé ńgÿo pɔ́ fùɔ, á piŋ nzèm fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, ńtóŋ megàŋafàʼ pé pie à la ná ntà metʉ̌a mbwó pɔ́b la, légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ shwóŋo yé páʼ pɔ́ ka cʉ̌ʼ ńtáŋ tà é gwɔ́ púʼu.
en: “At his return, having received the authority to be king, he summoned those servants he had given the money to, so that he could find out how much they had made in business.

ngiemboon: Andùŋmvfò tó, ńtyé mvfò yé ńgɔɔn ngie: “Ankwɔbɔ́, n tǎŋ nkáb gie ɔ̀ la ná né mèŋ la, tà njÿó pàg legém.”
en: The first came forward and said, ‘Master, your mina has earned ten more minas.’

ngiemboon: Afùɔ tsɔ́ʼ ngie: “Áa mbòŋ, ɔɔ ngàŋafàʼ wembòŋo. Páʼ ɔ̀ pɔ̌ɔn múɔ mémmó mboŋó la, n ge ná metÿǒsoŋ legém ɔ̀ ne ésáʼa.”
en: “ ‘Well done, good    servant! ’ he told him. ‘Because you have been faithful   # 19:17 Lk 16:10; 1Co 4:2 in a very small matter, have authority over ten towns.’

ngiemboon: Ambɔ́ɔntè yepʉ́a tó yé ńgɔɔn ngie: “Ankwɔbɔ́, n tǎŋ nkáb gie ɔ̀ la ná né mèŋ la, tà ńjÿó pàg sétʉ̂a.”
en: “The second came and said, ‘Master, your mina has made five minas.’

ngiemboon: Afùɔ tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: “Á gʉa na gù, mbà n dɔgɔ́ gú ńgÿo ngúmnɔ̀ɔn gẅie ɔ̀ ge sáʼ metÿǒsoŋ méntʉ̂a.”
en: “So he said to him, ‘You will be over five towns.’

ngiemboon: Wetsɔ̌ tó ńgɔɔn ngie: “Metʉ̌a, tàʼa pàga nkáb gù wa wɔɔn, n da lɔgɔ mmó nzsǒ ńkwɛ́ ńdeʼe.
en: “And another came and said, ‘Master, here is your mina. I have kept it safe in a cloth

ngiemboon: Ńzɔɔn ńdeʼe púʼu, pɔ́ mélàʼmie n da ne ḿbɔ́gɔ gú pɔ̌g. Ɔɔ nyìŋ ńcÿɔ́g tɛʼ, ɔɔ ḿbíi mmó pɔ́ jʉʼ gie ɔ̀ kà te wó nuŋe, ḿbiŋe ńkába mmó gie ɔ̀ kà te pye.”
en: because I was afraid of you since you’re a harsh man: you collect what you didn’t deposit and reap what you didn’t sow.’

ngiemboon: Afùɔ tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: “Ɔɔ ngàŋafàʼ we tepòŋ, n ge lɔg pɔ́ ncwò gú, é ŋaga gú. Ɔ̀ la zsé ngie mbàŋa nò yɔ̀ɔn tʉ tɛʼ, ngie n gee ḿbíi mmó pɔ́ jʉʼ gie n da te wó nuŋe, ńtsɔ́ʼɔ shúm pɔ́ jʉʼ gie n da te wó pye.
en: “He told him, ‘I will condemn you by what you have said, you evil servant! If you knew I was a harsh man, collecting what I didn’t deposit and reaping what I didn’t sow,

ngiemboon: Mélàʼakɔ́ ɔ̀ la te néŋ nkáb yɔɔn mbâŋ, á jʉʼ gie n ge gwaa tó kẅé, apì zébe mǒ wɔ́ɔ?”
en: why, then, didn’t you put my money in the bank? And when I returned, I would have collected it with interest.’

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwó pʉ̀a pie é laa jʉʼó ngie: “Pi gwoon yé, ńkẅé ye nkáb, ńnáa mbwó nyìŋ gẅie à jÿǒ nkáb pàg legém.”
en: So he said to those standing there, ‘Take the mina away from him and give it to the one who has ten minas.’

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zoŋ ńgɔɔn ngie: “Metʉ̌a, à ně ńdáʼ ńgẅiin!”
en: “But they said to him, ‘Master, he has ten minas.’

ngiemboon: Afùɔ tsɔ́ʼ ngie: “Mèŋ shwóŋo gẅí, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin mmó, mbà mé ge kẅiʼi tsɔ́ é ná né yé, à lɔg ńgẅiin tà á gyɔ́ɔn. Tá ńké ńgʉa na nyìŋ gẅie à te mmó gẅiin, mbà mé ge kẅé méjʉʼ gẅie à zɔɔn ńgẅiin.
en: “ ‘I tell you, that to everyone who has, more will be given; and from the one who does not have, even what he does have will be taken away.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na megàŋmbù pɔ́ɔn, epʉ̀a pá pie é ka ne ńdʉʼʉ ngie n te gwɔ́ fùɔ wɔb wɔ́ la, pi lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńtóo jʉʼɔɔn, ńgwaa wɔ́b mvfò mèŋ.”»
en: But bring here these enemies of mine,    who did not want me to rule over them, and slaughter   # 19:27 Or execute them in my presence.’ ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn yɔɔn sagánò mbwó láʼ tà ḿmag, ńcʉa ńgwɔ́ mvfò, ńne ḿbʉʉ né Yelúzálèm.
en: When   he had said these things, he went on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.  # 19:28 Lk 9:51

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ne ńkúu lepàa Mbɛlefajÿé pɔ́ Mbetani, á ngʉ̀ŋe lekwɛ́ metÿǒ mevɛ́ olive, ńtúm megàŋakwò pé pépʉ́a,
en: As he approached Bethphage and Bethany, at the place called the Mount of Olives,   he sent two of the disciples

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Pi gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ láʼ yɛ̂ gie áa mvfò pi lɛ̂. Pi ge kúu wó, é gyá múɔ nzikáasè gẅie mé ně ńcʉŋ, e gwɔ́ gie nyìŋ laa mǒ néŋe. Pi kyɛ́ʼ ńdɔg ńtó.
en: and said, “Go into the village ahead of you. As you enter it, you will find a colt tied there, on which no one has ever sat. Untie it and bring it.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ne ńkyɛ́ʼɛ, nyìŋ zɛ́te gẅí ngie: “Pi kyɛʼɛ nzikáasè yɛ̂ mélàʼakɔ́ wɔ́ɔ?” Pi tsɔ́ʼ ngie: “Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn.”»
en: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it? ’ say this: ‘The Lord needs it.’ ”

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie à tumó wɔ́b leen ńgʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńgyá akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ Yěsô ně shwóŋo wɔ́b.
en: So those who were sent left and found it just as he had told them.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne ńkyɛ́ʼɛ, megàŋ nzikáasè ŋwɛ́ zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: «Pi kyɛʼɛ múɔ nzikáasè yɛ̂ mélàʼakɔ́?»
en: As they were untying the colt, its owners said to them, “Why are you untying the colt? ”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Andè zɔ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn.»
en: “The Lord needs it,” they said.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔg nzikáasè ńtó tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, ńzáb menzsǒ fÿɔ́g mɔ́b nkàʼ yé, ńgÿo á kwɔ́ʼ ńnéŋe ndùmo.
en: Then   they brought it to Jesus, and after throwing their clothes on the colt, they helped Jesus get on it.  # 19:35 Zch 9:9

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgee, epʉ̀a ne ésaŋte menzsǒ mɔ́b ndùm mánzsè, á giŋe ndumó.
en: As he was going along, they were spreading their clothes on the road.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa tà ne fóo lekwɛ́ metÿǒ mevɛ́ olive ńcwoŋo, megàŋakwò pé pie é laa nzèm yé tà ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ láʼ, zye lékág, ńdɔg ngyè tetʉ̂ ńguʼte Ssé na menò mɔɔnmɔɔn mie pɔ́ lǎ gyá Yěsô gÿo,
en: Now he came near the path down the Mount of Olives, and the whole crowd of the disciples began to praise God joyfully with a loud voice for all the miracles they had seen:

ngiemboon: ńne ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Blessed is the King    who comes

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pafalísáyè pie é laa yɔ́b jʉʼó, éfó nùɔ láʼ, ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: «Tsítsà, gÿo megàŋakwò pú láŋte!»
en: Some of the Pharisees from the crowd told him, “Teacher, rebuke your disciples.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Mèŋ shwóŋo gẅí: Pɔ́ lɔɔn ńdáŋte, mbà metǒon ge pége jʉʼ!»
en: He answered, “I tell you, if they were to keep silent, the stones would cry out.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gʉa tà ne ńkúu Yelúzálèm, ńdíe tÿǒsoŋ ńzye lélʉa,
en: As he approached and saw the city, he wept   for it,

ngiemboon: ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Pi pà Yelúzálèm, pi ee lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, pi te ne ńzsé mmó gie ngwɔ́ á náa gẅí mbʉ́lè wɔ́, á ké yɛ̂, mbà á lyěen menÿɔ́g pi.
en: saying, “If you knew    this day what would bring peace #— #but now it is hidden   # 19:42 Lk 8:9–10; 10:21 from your eyes.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ ge gÿo gwɔ́, megàŋmbù pí tó, ńkwɛ́ nkáʼ ńdɔg ńkíle gẅí, éfó meshÿó meshÿó, ńtó ńnẅéʼe gẅí.
en: For the days will come on you    when your enemies will build a barricade around you, surround you, and hem you in on every side.   # 19:43 Is 29:3; Jr 6:6; Ezk 4:2; Lk 21:20

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ge gÿo tó, é gwɔʼɔ gẅí lâ gubé gí ntsèm, é gíŋ tágte tÿǒsoŋ gí tà pɔ́ le nyé tóon á gíŋ ńzébe na tsɔ̌ wɔ́. Ńtí nue pi ka te zsé fʉ̀ʼ gie e Ssé ka tǒ, légÿo nò mbòŋo na pi wɔ́.»
en: They will crush you and your children among you to the ground,    and they will not leave one stone on another   # 19:44 Lk 21:6 in your midst, because you did not recognize the time when God visited you.”   # 19:44 Ex 3:16; Lk 1:68; 7:16; 1Pt 2:12

ngiemboon: Yěsô fó jʉʼó, ńgʉa tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ ndá Ssé, ńzye létág pasẅiŋ shúm,
en: He   went into the temple and began to throw out those who were selling,  # 19:45 Other mss add and buying in it

ngiemboon: ńne ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Áa tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé, e Ssé gɔɔn ngie: “Ndá yɔ̀ɔn ge gÿo gwɔ́ ndá sẅíŋtè.” Tá pi léen sele ńdɔg ńgÿo nkʉ̀a metsǒŋ.»
en: and he said, “It is written, my house will be a house of prayer,    but you have made it a den of thieves! ”   # 19:46 Is 56:7; Jr 7:11,# 19:46 Jr 7:11

ngiemboon: Yěsô piŋ ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ ntsèm, ńne ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ndá Ssé ńzíʼi pʉ̀a nò Ssé, metándá panuŋepwɔʼ, pâ pakyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê mbɔɔ mekěm pà Yúndà ne faʼa shÿó légÿo mé zẅé yé.
en: Every day he was teaching   in the temple. The chief priests, the scribes, and the leaders of the people were looking for a way to kill  # 19:47 Lk 6:11; 11:53–54; 20:19 him,

ngiemboon: Tá faʼ shÿó kékáŋ, mélàʼmie aláʼ ntsèm la ne ńtʉ́ŋe tuŋó tɛʼ ńzẅíʼte nò gie Yěsô gɔɔn.
en: but they could not find a way to do it, because all the people   were captivated by what they heard.
